name: BEST WESTERN Airport Inn & Suites Cleveland

reviews.text: I stayed here while on my way to Niagara Fall, Canada. Very nice staff. Things to do, and places to eat are close by. Rooms are average...but they are clean. Continental breakfast was nice, and parking was just ok...
reviews.title: NOT A BAD PLACE TO STAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a typical Best Western hotel. It was clean and comfortable, but no frills. The hotel is in a bit of a shady area, but it was easy to get to from various major roadways, very close to the airport, and had adequate parking. It seems the hotel was recently renovated, and our room was decent. The hallways smelled like smoke, but the room didn't. There were some cigarette stains on the bathroom countertop, but it wasn't that bad. The room was large enough and the bed was comfortable, but it had an old style TV - I'd say a slight update needs to be made to a flat-screen. I also would've appreciated better black-out curtains that covered all of the window instead of just most of the window, because the lights on the exterior of the hotel shined into my bedroom. The hotel seemed to be fairly quiet, so no complaints there. The free breakfast was adequate, and in fact, seemed pretty robust for just a continental breakfast. The in-room WiFi was also adequate, so no complaints there, especially since it was also complimentary. There was also an airport shuttle, although I didn't use it -- but I appreciated the complimentary parking. I also didn't use the indoor pool or hottub, but noted that they were available. The hotel staff were all friendly and accommodating, and service was speedy during check in and check out. All in all, this hotel met my needs perfectly, as I was looking for a clean and comfortable hotel near the Cleveland airport, at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: No frills, no complaints

reviews.text: We were in the area for a family member's wedding, it was our first time to Ohio. The check-in was efficient, which was nice after having flown for almost 5 hours to get there. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the street even though it was facing the street the room was still quiet when we were trying to sleep.
reviews.title: It served its purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the indoor pool on the first night there, it was clean and refreshing. It was open from 8am-10pm. They had a hot tub but it was going through maintenance, they apologized for the inconvenience. They also had a 24-hour exercise room, we didn't use that facility though.
reviews.title: Ehh...one night only

reviews.text: The breakfast was average - they had juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, three types of cereal, oatmeal, breads, bagels, pastries, fruit and a waffle maker. The first two days it did the trick for us then on the last morning we went across the street to the Bob Evans restaurant.
reviews.title: Average
Great value
reviews.text: Front desk is very helpful. We got a rate of $67.99 online then found a book at a rest stop on the way in with a rate of $59 and they honored it. We stayed from January 14-15th. Room was nice, not as clean as it could have been. My son found a banana pepper on the floor. We had a non smoking queen double room, room 222. Room did smell of chlorine. Hallways do smell badly of smoke, but we did not spend time in the hallway. Breakfast was not great but it was free so why complain. We had coffee which was good and bananas which were a little ripe. I would stay here again if I was in need of a hotel while in Cleveland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night(Friday). We had a king non-smoking on the first floor facing Snow Rd. We did not smell any cigarette smoke in the hallway or room. The room was nice and appeared along with the bathroom to be clean. We did not notice any of the negative issues mentioned in previous posts. We did not eat the breakfast provided there. My only comment is that I noticed road traffic noise and I would stay here again but would request a room facing the rear of the building away from the street. We prefer the first floor for ease of egress but the upper floors may be quieter even on the street side.
reviews.title: Would stay here again but...

reviews.text: The lobby looks fresh but the room smell misty and my mom smoking room stank of cigarettes. Old, worn down amenities, tv didn't work, dirty bathtub and sink. Crappy stale breakfast and this is one of the few hotels I've stayed at that still has unwashed blankets on the bed. Get with the times folks. Wouldn't return.
reviews.title: Nice people but a dump to stay in

reviews.text: BW Airport Inn & Suites in Brook Park, Ohio is certainly a satisfactory place to spend a night. Rooms are fairly typical of the chain, with comfortable beds and solid furnishings. Bath towels are above average; bathtub has a shower mat pasted to the surface, so one has no choice but to shower rather than bathe. Continental breakfast is included in the rate, but is really nothing special. Many Best Westerns offer a better breakfast than this hotel's. About other reviewers complaining about hallways "reeking" of smoke: (1) I didn't notice it, and (2) how much time do you plan to spend in a hallway anyway? What is important is the comfort of your room, not the hallway! The hotel has a nice indoor pool; water temp. is a little cool, but not unpleasantly so. Overall, I would consider this a 3-star hotel, but the affordable rate (@ $79/night at BW's best rate) makes my review 4-star. By the way, hotel is very close to the Cleveland airport.
reviews.title: Satisfactory Hotel, And A Good Bargain

reviews.text: Location is great, shuttle to the IX Center is great, but the hotel is average at best. The second floor hallway reeked of smoke. The room was ok smellwise. Pillows were dirty and one even had blood stains on the pillow. Bathroom was big, but not so clean. Doorstop was broken as well. Also, one of the outlets in the bedroom was so loose it felt as if you could push it thru the wall. Not sure if I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Stay was Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived middle of the night and tired, so appreciated it was efficient check-in and a quiet room despite being close to freeways. Staff were all very nice, made an enjoyable stay. But be braced for strong cigarette smoke smell in the hallways. Our "smoke free" room was comfortable though. The breakfast had limited offerings but considering the price, was OK. If they could get rid of the smokey smelling hallways, we'd very likely stay there again.
reviews.title: Convenient for a price

reviews.text: We enjoyed our night at this location. We were here to take our daughter to the airport for a very early morning flight. The building is not the greatest and perhaps even a bit shabby in places. BUT, the staff all went so far to make our stay pleasant, that I am giving this place 5 star rating. It was nice and clean, good beakfast and very courteous and friendly Airport shuttle driver.
reviews.title: Best staff ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good for doing thing in Cleveland and the hotel is in quiet area of BrookPark. However, it's in need of a remodel as things are beginning to show wear. However, it was clean. The toilet tissue is quite rough so if that is a concern for you bring your own soft tissue! Pillows are a bit too full/firm so you might wish to bring your own pillows. The mattress is very firm. Staff is accomodating and the breakfast bar is standard Best Western fare.
reviews.title: Ok but beginning to show wear

reviews.text: This hotel is completely renovated - common areas and rooms. The rooms were updated in the last year, modern decor and very comfortable beds. The bathroom vanity area is huge! Room had a microwave and fridge as well. Only thing not updated was the tv in the room, but no big deal. My only complaint, as other reviews have stated, was way too much chlorine in the pool. We could only swim a short time because it burned our eyes. You could even smell it in the lobby. Breakfast was good - pastries, waffles, fruit, yogurt, toast/bagels. The area is very convienient as well. We travel to Cleveland every year for baseball games since we are Indians fans. This location is good because its near 2 major freeways. Downtown within 15 minutes and several shopping areas within 10 minutes. The only restaurant right across the street is Bob Evans, but if you go east on Snow Rd about a 1/2-1 mile you will run in to lots of restaurants. Staff was very friendly as well. Overall a great stay and will most likely come back here next year.
reviews.title: Excellent stay! Will come back next year!
Pretty Good
reviews.text: We had a good time although we wish we could have stayed in the pool longer, but there was too much chlorine in the water!. It was burning our eyes.

Vanilla. Not overly impressed...not a train wreck. Has some housekeeping issues but it was a very busy weekend with a lot of teenage activity. Room was very nice and clean, it was the common areas that needed attention, i.e. the elevator, hallways, breakfast room. Staff very accomodating and friendly.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: Not bad choice for that amount of money.Quiet,pretty clean,friendly staff.Only continental breakfast, however it was everything one needed.I would only change one thing-replace sugared cornflakes for plain to give a chance to eat to people with gluten and sugar problems.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night. I took advantage of the Stay & Fly package, which is worth the price (I paid under $100) and I got one night stay and 7 days of parking included. I was able to choose my pick up time for the airport shuttle and the man that drove me even stopped at the bank so I could use the ATM. The front desk manager was so friendly and he made sure I had everything I needed. The rooms have recently been updated but I don't think they did much to the bathrooms. When I returned to Cleveland, I called the hotel as soon as I got my bags and the shuttle was there to pick me up within 10 minutes. I will stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel. Very nice rooms, especially if you get a suite which has a separate kitchen and sofa sleeper for additional privacy. Nice breakfast, pool and spa, and fast wireless Internet. The entire staff were very friendly and helpful. Definitely put this on your list if staying close to the Cleveland Airport. They offer a great value for the quality you get.
reviews.title: Conveinent location

reviews.text: Stayed there for one night, the toillet was dirty with residue of urine. This is enough to me.
reviews.title: Filthy...
